questions.question_text: In an eleven-class queueing model following realtime, best effort, and scavenger queuing rules, what recommended percentage of bandwidth must be allocated for interactive video?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
per https://www.ciscopress.com/articles/article.asp?p=357102&seqNum=7#:~:text=If%20Scavenger%20and%20Bulk%20traffic,illustrated%20in%20Figure
%2012%2D10

Interactive video is 15%
Video – Interactive – AF41 13% is what I have from CBTGNuggets training

comments.content:
Interesting. OCG for this exam says 11 class QoS baseline model for interactive video should allocate 13% of available link bandwidth. Attached hyperlink says equal or less than 15%...
I love Cisco for such questions and inconsistency in their documentation. As always it depends on version you are working on lol

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct

questions.question_text: A Cisco TelePresence SX80 suddenly has issues displaying main video to a display over HDMI. Which command can you use from the SX80 admin CLI to check the video output status to the monitor?

discussion.content:
Should be A, xStatus Video Output
https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/td/docs/telepresence/endpoint/sx-series/tc7/api-reference-guide/sx80-api-reference-guide-tc71.pdf
Who fixes the answers on this site. ? Please let me know .

Selected Answer: A
it is an example with my MX300G2:

xstatus Video Output
*s Video Output Connector 1 Connected: True
*s Video Output Connector 1 MonitorRole: First
*s Video Output Connector 1 Resolution Height: 1080
*s Video Output Connector 1 Resolution RefreshRate: 60
*s Video Output Connector 1 Resolution Width: 1920
*s Video Output Connector 1 Type: LCD
*s Video Output Connector 2 Connected: False
*s Video Output Connector 2 ConnectedDevice Name: ""
*s Video Output Connector 2 ConnectedDevice PreferredFormat: ""
*s Video Output Connector 2 ConnectedDevice ScreenSize: -1
*s Video Output Connector 2 MonitorRole: Second
*s Video Output Connector 2 Resolution Height: 1080
*s Video Output Connector 2 Resolution RefreshRate: 60
*s Video Output Connector 2 Resolution Width: 1920
*s Video Output Connector 2 Type: HDMI
** end
OK
^C

You can also use the command from answer C: "xConfiguration Video Output" to show the resolution, but you also get alot of other parameters.

A is correct here.

Selected Answer: A
Should be A

Selected Answer: A
Correct answer is A

Selected Answer: A
can be easily tested, its A
Correct answer is A

questions.question_text: What is an indicator of network congestion in VoIP communications?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
C. is partially correct. It is talking about the gaps in the voice in order of the user experience. However, gaps is a consequence not just by packet loss, rather the gaps could be a consequence of several causes, for example, jitter, bad QoS treatment, bad packetization and big PDU's, even hardware problems.
A. is correct, because is more specific and precise.
Reference:
Implementing Cisco Unified Communications Voice over IP and QoS (CVOICE) Foundation Learning Guide Fourth Edition. Chapter 2: Configuring Basic Voice over IP.
Answer C

comments.content:
Per you source:
"Another common reason behind VoIP jitter is network congestion. Connecting a large number of devices to the same network runs the risk of running out of bandwidth quickly, thus leading to data packets being dropped/ delayed. "
Why would C isn't correct answer. In my opinion C and A are equally right.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Source https://justcall.io/blog/voip-jitter-how-to-measure-and-reduce-network-jitter.html

Selected Answer: A
I was thinking about D, but i pick A.

You can use policing, shaping etc when congestion occurs, so it wont nessecary discard if you have shaping instead of policing - Therefore D is not correct.

choices.D: discards in the interface of routers and switches
choices.B: video loss due to video frame corruption
choices.C: gaps in the voice due to packet loss
choices.A: jitter increase due to variable delay

questions.question_text: A Cisco Unity Connection Administrator must set a voice mailbox so that it can be accessed from a secondary device. Which configuration on the voice mailbox makes this change?

discussion.content: B. Alternate Ext
Alt. Ext. is correct.

Selected Answer: B
B. Alternate Extensions

Selected Answer: B
Alt Extn

B. Alternate Extensions
The alternate extension is not required but increases productivity and improves the user experience. You can set up alternate extensions, such as the mobile and home phone numbers, so the user can dial the CUC pilot number from these devices and use the personal login, where only the PIN needs to be entered. If a nondefined extension calls in to the CUC system, the standard opening greeting is played by default. Figure 24-7 illustrates the main parameters that need to be configured when creating a new user in CUC manually.
A is right because when forwarding rule exist you can access from a fixed extension. But with alternate extensions you can access the mailbox from any devices so it is not correct.
Has anyone recently taken the 350-801?

I found this: 

Configure the Call Routing Rule
This method re-routes any calls that are forwarded to the Cisco Unity system from the secondary phone (extension 6007) to the extension number of the primary phone (6001).

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/voice-unified-communications/unity/41600-2-ip-phones-1-mbox.html

So.. Dumb question, but despite all the disagreements, are the ones marked "Correct Answer" what the proctors are looking for?? How do we know which is the actual correct answer to choose on the tests?
Correct Answer ist "B" Alternate Extension"

Alt. Ext is correct.
lternate Extensions
In addition to the primary extension for each user, you can set up alternate extensions. Alternate extensions can be used for various reasons, such as handling multiple line appearances on user phones. Alternate extensions can also make calling Unity Connection from an alternate device, such as a mobile phone or a phone at another work site more convenient.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/connection/10x/administration/guide/10xcucsagx/10xcucsagappa.html#92809
Has anyone confirmed which answer Cisco is looking for. Alternate Ext seems right, but why do all sample question sites state Attempt forward routing rule?

questions.question_text: Which Cisco Unified Communications Manager configuration is required for SIP MWI integrations?

discussion.content:
https://community.cisco.com/t5/collaboration-voice-and-video/understanding-troubleshooting-mwi-on-unity-connection/ta-p/3162948

C Enable Accept unsolicited notification on the SIP Trunk Security Profile. 

In case of SIP integration, CUC sends SIP notify messages to the phone system to turn the MWI on or OFF so “Accept unsolicited notification” should be checked under SIP security profile assigned to the trunk

Selected Answer: C
C is correct answer.

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer. Verified on multiple forums

C


https://community.cisco.com/t5/collaboration-voice-and-video/understanding-troubleshooting-mwi-on-unity-connection/ta-p/3162948#:~:text=In%20case%20of%20SIP%20integration%2C%20CUC%20sends%20SIP%20notify%20messages%20to%20the%20phone%20system%20to%20turn%20the%20MWI%20on%20or%20OFF%20so%20%E2%80%9CAccept%20unsolicited%20notification%E2%80%9D%20should%20be%20checked%20under%20SIP%20profile%20assigned%20to%20the%20trunk.

In case of SIP integration, CUC sends SIP notify messages to the phone system to turn the MWI on or OFF so “Accept unsolicited notification” should be checked under SIP profile assigned to the trunk.

https://community.cisco.com/t5/collaboration-voice-and-video/understanding-troubleshooting-mwi-on-unity-connection/ta-p/3162948

C - unsolicited notification
diversion header is used in call forwarding scenarios

According https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/connection/11x/integration/guide/cucm_sip/b_cucintcucmsip.pdf

Select "Redirecting Diversion Header Delivery - Inbound" on the SIP trunk -> valid answer
Select "Redirecting Diversion Header Delivery - Outbound" on the SIP trunk -> valid answer
Enable "Accept unsolicited notification" on the SIP Trunk Security Profile. -> valid answer

Anybody has any clues on this question?

choices.B: Enable ג€Accept presence subscriptionג€ on the SIP Trunk Security Profile.
choices.C: Enable ג€Accept unsolicited notificationג€ on the SIP Trunk Security Profile.
choices.D: Select ג€Redirecting Diversion Header Delivery - Outboundג€ on the SIP trunk.
choices.A: Select ג€Redirecting Diversion Header Delivery - Inboundג€ on the SIP trunk.
